abstract: Some landlords in East Harlem are deliberately keeping their buildings mostly vacant, content to earn income from first-floor commercial tenants rather than deal with the trouble of residents; phenomenon leaves many people mystified.
snippet: Above the bustling street level, apartments in East Harlem are boarded up and vacant, with owners content to earn income off storefronts rather than deal with the trouble of renters.
lead_paragraph: Above the bustling street level, apartments in East Harlem are boarded up and vacant, with owners content to earn income off storefronts rather than deal with the trouble of renters.

headline.main: In East Harlem, ‘Keep Out’ Signs Apply to Renters
headline.print_headline: In East Harlem, ‘Keep Out’ Signs Apply to Renters
headline.seo: East Harlem Landlords Keep Apartments Sealed Up
